Hello Comunity, my problem is that i have an already existing excel file with Conditional Formatting rules in a Column, i read it and save it with the next sentences:

$objReader = new PHPExcel_Reader_Excel2007();

$objReader->setReadDataOnly(false);
$objPHPExcel = $objReader->load('../files/Reportes.xlsx');

//i set a value

 $objPHPExcel->getActiveSheet()->SetCellValue('F6', 10);

$objWriter = new PHPExcel_Writer_Excel2007($objPHPExcel);

 $objWriter->save('../files/Reportes.xlsx');

 

the output file is my Reportes.xlsx file without any Conditional Formating rules :S

 

i read in a post(a 2010 post)  that this is a bug, im using the 1.7.6 of PHPEXCEL

plz help me, Thanks

exact same problem.

What I'm trying to do is opening a xls with the template that I need, fill it with database info and then export it. Data is fine, but the selection list of some columns present in the original template are gone in the exported file.

Just wondering if phpExcel can't handle that or if its a bug.
